beers.name: Blonde
beers.tasting_notes: A light golden-coloured ale. Hoppy aroma and a refreshing smack of fruity citrus.

beers.name: Classic English Ale
beers.tasting_notes: Deep amber in colour with a light hoppy aroma and rich, rounded malty taste.

styles.name: Mild
styles.description: Light drinking beers with low hop character, including dark, pale, and Scottish milds.

subtypes.name: Dark Mild
subtypes.description: Sweet with light bitterness, featuring malt and roasted notes like chocolate, coffee, and liquorice.

subtypes.name: Pale Mild
subtypes.description: Lightly hopped with a light fruit character, malty sweetness, and notes of toffee or butterscotch.

subtypes.name: Scottish Light (60 Shillings)
subtypes.description: Dominated by malt, with toffee or butterscotch, and lightly hopped.
